intro: Eriope nudicaulis, commonly known as the slender eriope, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and wetlands. It has slender, erect stems and small, hairy leaves. Its flowers are usually yellow or white, and they bloom in the spring and early summer.
